ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Pioneer 11 Cosmic-Ray Telescope (CRT) 6-hr fluxes and rates

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata
Added PublicationInfo. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. ZCB
Added MetadataRightsList and RightsList(s). Updated to 2.7.1. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: This data set has eight 6-hour fluxes (3.45-5.15, 30.55-56.47 and 120.7-227.3 MeV protons, 3.44-4.97, 10.03-21.7, 30.67-56.7 and 112.7-413 MeV/n alpha particles, and 2-6 MeV electrons), 28 count rates, and Poisson uncertainties in the fluxes and rates, as determined from the Cosmic Ray Telescope (CRT) on the Pioneer 11 spacecraft. Data are in annual files with consistent end-of-record marks. Spacecraft position data are not given in the data records but are accessible from Helioweb at http://cohoweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/helios/heli.html
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: the Principal Investigator, Frank B. McDonald

Rights.Note: CC0 1.0 Universal is the Creative Commons license applicable to all publicly available NASA Heliophysics data products

AccessURL.Name: FTPBrowser
AccessURL.Description: For display and retrieval of parameter subsets

AccessURL.Name: Multi-Source Spectral Plot
AccessURL.Description: Multi-source spectral plots (MSSP) of energetic particle fluxes for Z less than or equal to 2.

AccessURL.Name: FTPS from SPDF (not with most browsers)
AccessURL.Description: For ftp downloading of annual files

AccessURL.Name: HTTPS from SPDF
AccessURL.Description: In CDF via HTTP from SPDF

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: the Principal Investigator, Frank B. McDonald, and FTPBrowser at SPDF

Parameter.Name: Proton Flux 3.45-5.15 MeV
Parameter.Description: This flux is obtained from LET-I and is derived from pulse height data using R11A for normalization

Parameter.Name: Proton Flux 30.55-56.47 MeV
Parameter.Description: This flux is obtained from HET and is derived from pulse height data using R1 for normalization

Parameter.Name: Proton Flux 120.7-227.3 MeV
Parameter.Description: This flux is obtained from HET and is derived from pulse height data using R2 for normalization

Parameter.Name: Helium Flux 3.44-4.97 MeV/n
Parameter.Description: This flux is obtained from LET-1 and is derived from pulse height data using R11B for normalization

Parameter.Name: Helium Flux 10.03-21.7 MeV/n
Parameter.Description: This flux is obtained from LET-1 and is derived from pulse height data using R11B for normalization

Parameter.Name: Helium Flux 30.67-56.7 MeV/n
Parameter.Description: This flux is obtained from HET and is derived from pulse height data using R2B for normalization

Parameter.Name: Helium Flux 112.7-413 MeV/n
Parameter.Description: This flux is obtained from HET and is derived from pulse height data using R3A for normalization

Parameter.Name: Electron Flux 2-6 MeV
Parameter.Description: This flux is obtained from HET and is derived from pulse height data using R1 for normalization

Parameter.Name: Poisson uncertainties in fluxes
Parameter.Description: These are the Poisson uncertainties in the eight fluxes named above as scalars. In the data records, each immediately follows the flux it refers to.

Parameter.Name: Count rates
Parameter.Description: These are 28 6-hour-averaged count rates corresponding to various telescope sensors singly and in coincidence, and, for some, for various levels of energy deposition in sensors. The documentation cited above gives conditions for each rate: which sensors, which species (one or more), etc.

Parameter.Name: Count rate uncertainties
Parameter.Description: These are Poisson uncertainties in each of the above-identified 28 6-hour-averaged count rates corresponding to various telescope sensors singly and in coincidence, and, for some, for various levels of energy deposition in sensors. The documentation cited above gives conditions for each rate: which sensors, which species (one or more), etc. The uncertainty for each count rate immediately follows that count rate in the data records.
